title: Ursula von der Leyen will attend Council summit
text:
European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen meets EU Council President Donald Tusk | Oliver Hoslet/AFP via Getty Images Ursula von der Leyen will attend Council summit Tusk invites Commission-president elect to present her 5-year plan to EU leaders.

Commission President-elect Ursula von der Leyen will get a preview of what it's like to sit at the EU leaders' table with a guest appearance at October's European Council summit.

Von der Leyen doesn't take office until November 1, but Council President Donald Tusk on Monday invited her to attend the leaders' summit on October 18 and 19 and present her plans for her five-year term.

Very good discussion with Ursula @vonderleyen on Europe's priorities. I have invited the President-elect for the October #EUCO to present and discuss her plans for the next five years with the leaders. pic.twitter.com/WAVD3iFewg — Donald Tusk (@eucopresident) September 30, 2019

Leaders are bracing for a potentially difficult summit, with Brexit looming large on their agenda.

The EU leadership transition is well underway with the European Parliament this week conducting hearings to question nominees for the next College of Commissioners.

Tusk's invitation, which he extended during a lunch with von der Leyen on Monday, seemed designed to help smooth the transition. But her presence will also highlight the lame-duck status of outgoing Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker. The Council President-elect, Charles Michel, will also be attending the summit — but in his current capacity as prime minister of Belgium.
description: Tusk invites Commission-president elect to present her 5-year plan to EU leaders.
